00022 /*
00023 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00024 
00025 The PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method produces
00026 an improved signal by accounting for experimentally observed patterns 
00027 in feature behavior and handling error at the appropriately at low and 
00028 high signal values.
00029 
00030 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00031 */
00032 
00033 /*
00034  * affyplier.h: interface for the caffyplier class.
00035  */
00036 
00037 #if !defined(PLIERCLASS_HEADER)
00038 #define PLIERCLASS_HEADER
00039 
00040 #include "plier/iaffyplier.h"
00041 //
00042 
00043 #define PLIER_IMPL_NAME "PLIER"
00044 #define PLIER_IMPL_VER "1.1"
00045 
00046 /*
00047  * structures for storing PLIER parameters
00048  */
00049 
00050 typedef struct
00051 {
00052         double augmentation;
00053         double defaultFeatureResponse;
00054         double defaultTargetResponse;
00055         double seaconvergence;
00056         double plierconvergence;
00057         double dropmax;
00058         double lambdalimit;
00059         float attenuation;
00060         float gmcutoff;
00061         float differentialfeaturepenalty;
00062         float differentialtargetpenalty;
00063         bool usemm;
00064         bool usemodel;
00065         bool fitFeatureResponse;
00066         long seaiteration;
00067         long plieriteration;
00068         long optimization;
00069         long balancetype;
00070         // new parameters
00071         // flag to use new tricks
00072         long fixPrecomputed;
00073         // when zero values are present take 'safe' started logs
00074         double safetyZero;
00075         // check convergence of TargetResponse to this limit
00076         double NumericalConvergenceLimit;
00077         bool FixFeatureEffect;
00078 } plier_params;
00079 
00080 /*
00081  * PLIER implementation class which inherits from iplier interface class
00082  */
00083 
00084 class caffyplier : public iaffyplier
00085 {
00086   // plier doesnt own any of this memory - dont try to free it.
00087         long num_exp;
00088         long num_feature;
00089         double** pm;
00090         double** mm;
00091         double** wt; // weights, if there
00092         double** residuals;
00093         long* replicate;
00094         double* TargetResponse;
00095         double* FeatureResponse;
00096         plier_params params;
00097 
00098 public:
00099         caffyplier();
00100         virtual ~caffyplier();
00101 
00102 public:
00103 
00104         /* PLIER parameters - Initialization */
00105         virtual void setInitAugmentation(double val) { params.augmentation=val; }
00106         virtual void getInitAugmentation(double* outval) { *outval=params.augmentation; }
00107         virtual void setInitDefaultFeatureResponse(double val) { params.defaultFeatureResponse=val; }
00108         virtual void getInitDefaultFeatureResponse(double* outval) { *outval=params.defaultFeatureResponse; }
00109         virtual void setInitDefaultTargetResponse(double val) {params.defaultTargetResponse=val; }
00110         virtual void getInitDefaultTargetResponse(double* outval) { *outval=params.defaultTargetResponse; }
00111 
00112         /* PLIER parameters - SEA */
00113         virtual void setSeaAttenuation(float val) { params.attenuation=val; }
00114         virtual void getSeaAttenuation(float* outval) { *outval=params.attenuation; }
00115 
00116         /* PLIER parameters - SEA Optimization */
00117         virtual void setSeaOptConvergence(double val) { params.seaconvergence=val; }
00118         virtual void getSeaOptConvergence(double* outval) { *outval=params.seaconvergence; }
00119         virtual void setSeaOptIteration(long val) { params.seaiteration=val; }
00120         virtual void getSeaOptIteration(long* outval) { *outval=params.seaiteration; }
00121 
00122         /* PLIER parameters - PLIER */
00123         virtual void setPlierGmCutoff(float val) { params.gmcutoff=val; }
00124         virtual void getPlierGmCutoff(float* outval) { *outval=params.gmcutoff; }
00125         virtual void setPlierDifferentialFeaturePenalty(float val) { params.differentialfeaturepenalty=val; }
00126         virtual void getPlierDifferentialFeaturePenalty(float* outval) { *outval=params.differentialfeaturepenalty; }
00127         virtual void setPlierDifferentialTargetPenalty(float val) { params.differentialtargetpenalty=val; }
00128         virtual void getPlierDifferentialTargetPenalty(float* outval) { *outval=params.differentialtargetpenalty; }
00129         virtual void setPlierUseMMLikelihood(bool val) { params.usemm=val; }
00130         virtual void getPlierUseMMLikelihood(bool* outval) { *outval=params.usemm; }
00131         virtual void setPlierUseInputModel(bool val) { params.usemodel=val; }
00132         virtual void getPlierUseInputModel(bool* outval) { *outval=params.usemodel; }
00133         virtual void setPlierFitFeatureResponse(bool val) { params.fitFeatureResponse=val; }
00134         virtual void getPlierFitFeatureResponse(bool* outval) { *outval=params.fitFeatureResponse; }
00135         
00136         /* PLIER parameters - PLIER Optimization */
00137         virtual void setPlierOptConvergence(double val) { params.plierconvergence=val; }
00138         virtual void getPlierOptConvergence(double* outval) { *outval=params.plierconvergence; }
00139         virtual void setPlierOptIteration(long val) { params.plieriteration=val; }
00140         virtual void getPlierOptIteration(long* outval) { *outval=params.plieriteration; }
00141         virtual void setPlierOptDropMax(double val) { params.dropmax=val; }
00142         virtual void getPlierOptDropMax(double* outval) { *outval=params.dropmax; }
00143         virtual void setPlierOptLambdaLimit(double val) { params.lambdalimit=val; }
00144         virtual void getPlierOptLambdaLimit(double* outval) { *outval=params.lambdalimit; }
00145         virtual void setPlierOptOptimizationMethod(long val) { params.optimization=val; }
00146         virtual void getPlierOptOptimizationMethod(long *outval) { *outval=params.optimization; }
00147         virtual void setPlierOptBalanceMethod(long val) { params.balancetype=val; }
00148         virtual void getPlierOptBalanceMethod(long *outval) { *outval=params.balancetype; }
00149 
00150         /* PLIER Inputs */
00151         virtual void setNumExp(long val) { num_exp=val; }
00152         virtual void getNumExp(long* val) { *val=num_exp; }
00153         virtual void setNumFeature(long val) { num_feature=val; }
00154         virtual void getNumFeature(long* val) { *val=num_feature; }
00155         virtual void setReplicate(long* val) { replicate=val; }
00156         virtual void getReplicate(long** val) { *val=replicate; }
00157         virtual void setPM(double** val) { pm=val; }
00158         virtual void getPM(double*** val) { *val=pm; }
00159         virtual void setMM(double** val) { mm=val; }
00160         virtual void getMM(double*** val) { *val=mm; }
00161 
00162         /*PLIER OPTIONAL INPUT*/
00163         virtual void setWT(double ** val){wt = val;}
00164         virtual void getWT(double *** val){*val = wt;}
00165 
00166         /* PLIER Inputs/Outputs */
00167         virtual void setTargetResponse(double* val) { TargetResponse=val; }
00168         virtual void getTargetResponse(double** val) { *val=TargetResponse; }
00169         virtual void setFeatureResponse(double* val) { FeatureResponse=val; }
00170         virtual void getFeatureResponse(double** val) { *val=FeatureResponse; }
00171 
00172         /* PLIER Parameters (RESERVED FOR FUTURE) */
00173         virtual void setUseTargetResponse(bool) {};
00174         virtual void getUseTargetResponse(bool*outval) {};
00175         virtual void setUseBg(bool) {};
00176         virtual void getUseBg(bool*outval) {};
00177         virtual void setUseTargetResponseSd(bool) {};
00178         virtual void getUseTargetResponseSd(bool*outval) {};
00179         virtual void setUseFeatureResponseSd(bool) {};
00180         virtual void getUseFeatureResponseSd(bool*outval) {};
00181 
00182         /* PLIER Parameters {added} */
00183         virtual void setFixPrecomputed(bool val){params.fixPrecomputed = val;};
00184         virtual void getFixPrecomputed(bool *val){*val = (params.fixPrecomputed!=0);};
00185         virtual void setNumericalTolerance(double inval){params.NumericalConvergenceLimit = inval;};
00186         virtual void getNumericalTolerance(double *outval){*outval = params.NumericalConvergenceLimit;};
00187         virtual void setSafetyZero(double val){params.safetyZero = val;};
00188         virtual void getSafetyZero(double *val){*val = params.safetyZero;};
00189         virtual void setFixFeatureEffect(bool b) {params.FixFeatureEffect = b;}
00190         virtual void getFixFeatureEffect(bool* b) {*b = params.FixFeatureEffect;}
00191 
00192         /* PLIER Inputs (RESERVED FOR FUTURE) */
00193         virtual void setBg(double**) {};
00194         virtual void getBg(double***) {};
00195 
00196         /* PLIER Inputs/Outputs (RESERVED FOR FUTURE) */
00197         virtual void setTargetResponseSd(double*) {};
00198         virtual void getTargetResponseSd(double**) {};
00199         virtual void setFeatureResponseSd(double*) {};
00200         virtual void getFeatureResponseSd(double**) {};
00201 
00202         // IMPLEMENTED FOR UTILITY
00203         virtual void setResiduals(double** val) {residuals=val;};
00204         virtual void getResiduals(double*** val) { *val=residuals;};
00205         /* PLIER Outputs (RESERVED FOR FUTURE) */
00206         virtual void setCallPvalue(double*) {};
00207         virtual void getCallPvalue(double**) {};
00208         virtual void setLikelihood(double*) {};
00209         virtual void getLikelihood(double**) {};
00210 
00211         /*
00212          * Set to default PLIER parameters. This is called by the constructor.
00213      * in general you probably do not want to call any of these unless you
00214      * are explicitly trying to model a particular PLIER behavior.
00215      * 
00216          * Input parameters :
00217          *       buffer - [in] Reserved; must be 0
00218          */
00219         virtual void setDefault(void* buffer=0);
00220 
00221     /*
00222      * Set the parameters to the AA set. This is the older PLIER behavior
00223      */
00224         virtual void setDefaultAA();
00225 
00226     /*
00227      * Set the parameters to the AB set. This is the default set. This
00228      * parameter set improves the stability of plier results when using
00229      * pre-computed feature responses. 
00230      */
00231         virtual void setDefaultAB();
00232 
00233         /*
00234          * Interface to run the PLIER algorithm to obtain outputs
00235          * Input parameter :
00236          *       error_code - [out] Pointer to a long integer which receives
00237          *                    the error code value, set to 0 if no error
00238          */
00239         virtual void run(long* error_code);
00240 
00241         /*
00242          * Get the plier object implementation name and version number
00243          * Input parameters :
00244          *       plier_impl_name - [out] Pointer to a buffer that receives
00245          *                         a null-terminated string containing the implementation name.
00246          *                         The buffer size should be large enough to contain
00247          *                         MAX_IMPLNAME_LENGTH + 1 characters
00248          *
00249          *       plier_impl_ver  - [out] Pointer to a buffer that receives
00250          *                         a null-terminated string containing the 
00251          *                         The buffer size should be large enough to contain
00252          *                         MAX_IMPLVER_LENGTH + 1 characters
00253          */
00254         virtual void getImplInfo(char* plier_impl_name, char* plier_impl_ver);
00255 
00256 protected:
00257 
00258         /* 
00259          * if input replicate is NULL, set it to default replicate
00260          * i.e. each experiment is in its own replicate group
00261          */
00262         virtual void setDefaultReplicate(long size, long* replicate);
00263 
00264         /*
00265          * validate the input parameters before running the algorithm
00266          * return 0 if validation ok
00267          */
00268         virtual long validateParams();
00269 
00270         /*
00271          * validate the inputs before running the algorithm
00272          * return 0 if validation ok
00273          */
00274         virtual long validateInputs();
00275 
00276 };
